body.p:
Springfield Ky
May 9 1864
Hon T E Bramlette
Govr of Ky
Dear Sir --

You have as I understand been informed by the Jailor of this County of the escape from Jail of Thomas Edward Maddox on the day of last, and thinking perhaps it my duty as County Judge to officially inform you of the fact in order that a reward may be offered for his arrest --

He was charged with killing Wm A Brothers of this County and was tried before an examining Court and refused bail and was consequently Confined in Jail, A party of lawless men came into town in the night and broke the Jail door open and took him out -- I am satisfied if a suitable reward was offered, he would be arrested,
He is about 5 feet 8 inches high, light complected, dark hair, about 45 or 50 years of age --

I understand that he is now in Capt Bells Company, 11th Ky Cavalry --
stationed at Halls Gap --

Respectfully --
John McIntire
Presiding Judge of the Washington County Court
